body: "I’m sorry Grace. The answer is no.”

"Oh it’s okay,” She said it so quickly it sounded like one word, straightening her back upright, "That’s what I thought you were going to say. I don’t feel that way anymore. I was just getting it out of my system. I’m actually interested in someone--”
"Alright,” I raised my voice to cut her off, "Great.”
"Great.” She parroted. Then, after a long pause of her looking at anything except for me, "Anything else?”
"...You should probably change the name in the monologue before you turn it in.” I squinted again at the paper, "Maybe mention Beth more.”
She took the paper from me, leaning across the table with a tense expression and hands that were just slightly trembling, "See you Monday, then.”
Before I could react, she stood up, turning towards the entrance, "Wait a second,” I started, unsure of what I would have said next.
She wouldn’t turn her head around an inch. I followed her with me eyes as she left, pushing the door hard enough for it to slam into the glass wall. <VARIABLE(sarah)>
Maybe then I'd be a more <CHOICE(0)> away.

options.true: As she left, I swore I saw the outline of Sarah slipping past her into the open doorway, peering around the area aimlessly. I couldn’t handle it, not now. Slipping my laptop into my bag, I retreated deeper into the guts of the library.
options.false: In that moment, I imagined that she kept walking until dawn, where she would be far beyond the city and farther away from me.
